obstetricsData.obstetricsKS_1: Was your baby placed on your chest/abdomen for skin-to-skin contact immediately after birth?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKS_2: How long was your baby in skin-to-skin contact with you?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKS_3: How long after birth was your baby returned to stay with you?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKS_4: Was your baby breastfed for the first time before getting separated from you?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKS_5: During the postpartum period in the hospital, did you give the baby water or formula milk?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKS_6: During your hospital stay, did the medical staffs give you advice and guidance on breastfeeding?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKS_7: Did doctors and nurses in the hospital counsel you to use formula milk for babies under 24 months? (except for cases specifically prescribed by doctors)
obstetricsData.obstetricsKS_8: Did you see any forms of advert/marketing of formula milk for babies aged under 24 months, feeding bottles and artificial pacifiers in the hospital?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKN_1: Was the baby incubated in the Kangaroo position (≥20 hours/day, intermittent ≤ 30 minutes/time)?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKN_2: Were you allowed to stay with your baby or visit your baby at least once a day while s/he was quarantined in the Neonatal Resuscitation unit?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKN_3: During the hospital stay, what did your baby eat?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKN_4: How did your baby have breast milk?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKN_5: During your hospital stay, did the medical staffs give you advice and guidance on breastfeeding?
obstetricsData.obstetricsKN_6: Did doctors and nurses in the hospital counsel you to use formula milk for babies under 24 months? (except for cases specifically prescribed by doctors)
obstetricsData.obstetricsKN_7: Did you see any forms of advert/marketing of formula milk for babies aged under 24 months, feeding bottles and artificial pacifiers in the hospital?
obstetricsData.obstetricsPassKS_1: “Pass” if more than 80% of mothers giving birth vaginally, and 50% of mothers having C-section answer Yes
obstetricsData.obstetricsPassKS_2: “Pass” if more than 80% mothers giving birth vaginally, and 50% of mothers having C-section answer “More than 90 minutes”
obstetricsData.obstetricsPassKS_3: “Pass” if more than 95% of mothers giving birth vaginally answer “Immediately after giving birth”
obstetricsData.obstetricsPassKS_4: “Pass” if more than 80% of mothers giving birth vaginally, and 50% of mothers having C-section answer Yes
obstetricsData.obstetricsPassKS_5: “Pass” if more than 90% of mothers giving birth vaginally and having C-section answer No
obstetricsData.obstetricsPassKS_6: “Pass” if more than 80% of mothers giving birth vaginally and having C-section answer Yes
obstetricsData.obstetricsPassKS_7: “Pass” if 100% mothers giving birth vaginally and having C-section answer No (excluding cases specifically prescribed by doctors)
obstetricsData.obstetricsPassKS_8: “Pass” if 100% % mothers giving birth vaginally and having C-section answer No
